definition: Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
grandson/descendant
surname Sun
surname Quan
authority/power/right/(literary) to weigh/expedient/temporary

sentences.english: When Sun Quan reached the city walls, arrows rained down on him, and one struck his plumed helmet.
sentences.chinese: 权自到城下看时，城上箭如雨发，射中孙权麾盖。

sentences.english: Sun Quan, fearing for Ling Tong, ordered Lv Meng to bring him back to camp.
sentences.chinese: 孙权恐凌统有失，令吕蒙接应回营。

sentences.english: Sun then remembered his brother's words and asked the servant to send for Chou Yu at once.
sentences.chinese: 一句话提醒了孙权，马上派人到鄱阳请周瑜来。

sentences.english: It's the tomb of the Wu Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 而是三国东吴国王孙权的墓。

sentences.english: Despite being greatly outnumbered, Liu Bei and Sun Quan eventually won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 尽管兵力悬殊，刘备和孙权最后还是打赢了这场战役。

sentences.english: It has been extended to Sun Quan's 58th generation of descendants.
sentences.chinese: 如今已经延续到孙权的第五十八代子孙了。

sentences.english: They are all Sun Quan's descendants living in Longmen.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是居住在龙门镇的孙权后裔。

sentences.english: Zhao Wei will play Sun Shangxiang, the little sister of Sun Quan, the emperor of the Wu Kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 赵薇将在影片中扮演吴国皇帝孙权的小妹孙上香。

sentences.english: He is the 55th generation descendant of Sun Quan.
sentences.chinese: 他是龙门孙氏孙权后裔的五十五世。

sentences.english: Was Sun Quan the emperor of the State of Wu during the Three Kingdom Period?
sentences.chinese: 那么孙权就是三国鼎立时的吴国皇帝是吗？

sentences.english: Sun Quan tried with patience to persuade him to read more .
sentences.chinese: 孙权耐心地劝他多读一些书。

sentences.english: Over 7,000 of his descendants live here.
sentences.chinese: 这里居住着孙权后裔中的七千多人。

sentences.english: Elated, Zhuge Jin went with Kongming to see Xuande and represent Sun Quan’s letter.
sentences.chinese: 瑾大喜，即同孔明入见玄德，呈上孙权书。

sentences.english: " a "matter of course Sun Quan also carrying a parachute jump.
sentences.chinese: “一个”孙权也理所当然背着降落伞跳了。

definition: Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Zhou Yu or Chou Yü (175-210), famous general of the southern Wu kingdom and victor of the battle of Redcliff/in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, absolutely no match for Zhuge Liang
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴

Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Cao Pi (187-226), second son of Cao Cao 曹操, king then emperor of Cao Wei 曹魏 from 220, ruled as Emperor Wen 魏文帝, also a noted calligrapher
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
Sima Yi (179-251), warlord under Cao Cao and subsequently founder of the Jin dynasty
Xun Yu (163-212), brilliant strategist, advisor of Cao Cao in Three Kingdoms
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
Sima Zhao (211-265), military general and statesman of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4]

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
